title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
Hi, I have this board with a pulsing PP3v3_SUS @1,0-1,3v. U8020 and PP3V3_S5 and P3V3SUS_EN voltages are present and stable, changed U8020, no change... what can be causing this behavior? Any experience like this?
when I heat the pch a little it turns on... should I reflowit with flux?

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH; heat a bit.
Check first diode mode to ground at 3V3_SUS.

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
PP3v3_SUS = .530 (diode mode)
when removed F7140 PPBUS_G3H is 8,6
when F7140 in place PPBUS_G3H is not stable (aprox every 5 seconds varies from 8,6v as low as 8,10v)
Removed R5450 and PPBUS_G3H stays stable, when in place PPBUS_G3H gets unstable again

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
Put back the resistor and check if board stays on in SMC bypass mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.
Check for short on big coils from secondary power supplies.

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
17/18 = 3,5 ohm
27/28= 20,1 ohm
No short on secondary coils
Board stays on in SMC bypass mode

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
Then you have a problem with a I/V SMC sensor.
Board boots in SMC bypass, or just stays on?

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
now it is not turning on in smc bypass and was checking S4_PWR_EN and PM_SLP_S5_L is pulsing too...
SMC_PM_G2_EN is going low every 5 seconds guess thats why I can´t get stable voltage on secondary rails

coils diode mode
L7310= ,049
L7320= ,049
L7630= ,129
L7430= ,156
L7560= ,357
L7520= ,430
L7130= ,138
L3895= ,522
L7701= ,427

I don´t have a clue what is making PPBUS_G3H unstable... please help me!...

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message:
I suppose SMC_PM_G2_EN varies at same time with PPBUS_G3H; check what happens with 3V42_G3H.
When the board stopped to stay on in SMC bypass?
What was the last thing you've done before that?

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message: If I leave the PSU on, the board turns on after around 60 seconds @,300A and goes down to ,160A. CPU is not getting warm... no chime

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message: Which voltages appear on the board then?

title: 820-3437 PP3V3_SUS pulsing
message: when it turns "on", the pulsing on ppbus is gone and all the voltages that where pulsing stay stable... I´ll make the list of the rails present and let you know...
